comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Possibly Olney Arnold (1861-1916) — of Providence, Providence County, R.I. from politicalgraveyard.com/geo/RI/realestate.html "Born in Cumberland, Providence County, R.I., September 8, 1861. Democrat. Treasurer and manager Rogers Screw Company; president, Angell Land Company; delegate to Democratic National Convention from Rhode Island, 1888; member of Rhode Island state house of representatives, 1908; candidate for Governor of Rhode Island, 1908, 1909; U.S. Diplomatic Agent to Egypt, 1913-16, died in office 1916; U.S. Consul General in Cairo, 1914-16, died in office 1916; under investigation in 1916 on charges of making unneutral utterances. Unitarian. Died in Lisbon, Portugal, March 5, 1916 (age 54 years, 179 days). Interment at Swan Point Cemetery, Providence, R.I." The Evening statesman., November 02, 1909, Page Eight, Col 5 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn88085421/1909-11-02/ed-... has a photo of the Rhode Island politician that could be the same man.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Corpus Christi caller and daily herald., February 04, 1916, page 1, top of col 2 with photo chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn86088527/1916-02-04/ed-... has another picture. So he was in the news around the time of other photos in this batch.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: swanq: Thanks for finding that second article with the photo to confirm his identity as Olney Arnold. We will expand the record to reflect more of this info.
